technology.short_description: To raise the ragged banners above the legions can be taxing, for they may have been enchanted by other sorcerers.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: There's no way a man without a mind should be able to wield a weapon effectively, but he can, with supernatural help.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Skeletal and Zombie units
Weapon strength: +10% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: The rise of the greatest civilization in the Old World.

effects.description: Character experience gain per turn: +100

technology.short_description: Although it dilutes the bloodline, the Gift must be given out to those select few who prove useful.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.short_description: For countless generations of mortals, the Counts have held Sylvania. From here, they plot the takeover of the Empire, and eventually the world.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +25%
Hero capacity: +1 for all Heroes

technology.short_description: Vampires are faster, stronger, wiser, and vastly more powerful than the cattle in the West and those stunted fools in the mountains.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -25%
Hero action success chance: +10%

technology.short_description: The power of Nagash flows through the blood of every Von Carstein. They are the masters of magic, and none should dare oppose them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

technology.short_description: Every skirmish, battle, and war against the foolish mortal empires provides more servants and more troops for the Midnight Aristocracy.

effects.description: Recruit Rank: +1 for units recruited via Raise Dead
Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Raise dead cost: -20%

technology.short_description: At last, the Von Carsteins reign over an Empire of darkness, as is their birthright.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +100 with Empire
Allegiance points gained: +25%
Number of uses: +1 for "Eternal Empire" (Vlad campaign)

ui_effects.localised_text: 25% chance to restore up to 20% Hit Points in 20 seconds

effects.description: Dire Bats units summoned in every battle: +1 (Isabella campaign)

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Dire Bats units are summoned in every battle

items.colour_text: Elected sovereign, Protector of the Empire, Defiler of the Dark and wielder of Skull Splitter.

Ability: "The Reikland Runefang"

technology.short_description: Also known as the Tome of Bone, this dread volume, authored by Arkhan the Black, is filled with his secrets for instilling vigour and other deathly abilities into zombified and skeletal vessels.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Zombies units
Leadership: +4 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: A single-word boon, spoken during the ritual, will harden the skin of corpses as they jerk back to life.

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +10% chance for destroyed units to be restored after battle
Speed: +25% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: Speaking this Dark Magic mantra will bring forth yet more skeletal remains.

effects.description: Recruitment and Raise Dead cost: -25% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: Summoning long-lost warriors to join your shambling dead boosts the yearning hordes' capable champions.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: The Sylvanian elite enjoy eternal beauty, lavish parties, and wear the most elegant fashion. Never mind that smell…

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Vampire Counts
Diplomatic relations: +50 with Vampire Coast
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Vampire Counts
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Vampire Coast

items.colour_text: The courts of the Vampire Counts have always been houses of intrigue and cutthroat politics. They will fall in line like all the rest.

effects.description:

	(local province)

technology.short_description: Through legitimate political claim, or forceful invasion, the Empire WILL fall to the Von Carstein regime.

effects.description: Research rate: +10%

Missile strength: +25% for Sylvanian Crossbowmen and Sylvanian Handgunners units

items.colour_text: Especially skilled human familiars are left with fragments of their mind intact, the better to serve their new lords.

effects.description:

technology.short_description: The southern desert contains the remains of a once great civilisation. The Nehekharans are an affront to the purity of the Vampire Counts and they must be destroyed and returned to the sands.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%
Immune to Desert attrition
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Tomb Kings

items.colour_text: Our ancient enemies cannot be bargained with or coerced, but sufficiently powerful incantations can wrest control of the spells which animate their bodies.

effects.description:

technology.short_description: Insights gained from otherworldly sources needn't be feared.

technology.short_description: Centuries of experience allow Heinrich to extract every part of the countless dead.

technology.short_description: Long years of wandering as a madman have not reduced Kemmler's resoulve in the slightest.

technology.short_description: Blessed be the ties that bind, for they shall last forever.

effects.description: Battle healing cap: +100% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: The armour many soldiers are buried with is brought back to the surface - a gift from the grave.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Grave Guard and Black Knights units

technology.short_description: None but Ghorst could have brought rotting corpses and mindless fanatics to this level of martial perfection.

effects.description: Speed: +50% for Crypt Ghoul and Crypt Horror units

Melee attack: +4 for Vargheist units
Melee defence: +4 for Vargheist units

technology.short_description: An unnatural lifespan has granted this Castellan Engineer deep knowledge of arcane and mechanical arts.

technology.short_description: The coming of death isn't necessarily a disadvantage, and can even prove the most special of boons.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 20% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: Ghorst insidiously brings his rebellious subjects to heel through a combination of assassination, bribery, and diplomacy.

technology.short_description: For centuries, this tome of beasts has been required reading for Necromancers who wish ultimate control, training and mastery of the dread creatures that lurk by the graveside.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units

technology.short_description: There are words of power to control Vampires that have been lost to the bestial side hidden within them.

technology.short_description: In death, a Terrorgheist becomes a nightmare made real. Guided by its master's will, the monstrosity creaks through the clouds above the battlefield on blotch-skinned pinions, its rotten flesh and withered organs open to the night air.
